title: 1981–82 Combined Counties Football League
text:
The 1981–82 Combined Counties Football League season was the fourth in the history of the <a href="Combined%20Counties%20Football%20League">Combined Counties Football League</a>, a <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in England.
With the arrival of several new clubs, the league was split into two divisions – East and West. The Eastern Division was won by <a href="Malden%20Town%20F.C.">Malden Town</a>, after they won the league the previous season. The Western Division was won by <a href="Ash%20United%20F.C.">Ash United</a>. There was a championship playoff, which was won 3–0 on aggregate by Ash United. There was no promotion or relegation, although some clubs left the league at the end of the season and it reverted to a single division.
The league switched to the system of three points for a win, instead of two.
Eastern Division.
The Eastern Division featured eleven clubs, all from the previous season Combined Counties League.
Western Division.
The Western Division featured seven clubs from the previous season Combined Counties League along with four new clubs:
